content.description: White Rabbit is a wild, short, bouldery route with a sidepull and crimp crux.
content.location: It is the second route from the right on the last wall to the right.

content.description: This is a handcrack without protection to start.  Halfway up it moves to left under an overhang to join up with route to left. From that shelf, go up and over to large pockets and the anchors.
content.protection: Hands to start to 2 bolts, anchors.
content.location:
This is just a few minutes past the entrance.  Look for the big crack around a corner, leading up to an overhang.  It is just left of

Head Games

.

content.description: Climb past three bolts to a two bolt anchor.
content.location:
This is the next route to the right of "

Miss Earth

."

content.description:
Climb up big holds on steep rock for three bolts before an easy runout to the

Big Boy

anchor.  It is dirty sometimes.
content.location:
This is just to the right of the

Big Boy

arete.

content.description: The crux is the power move about 8-10 feet up. It has tricky hands.  This is a stemming corner with a good amount of technical features.
content.location:
This is the second route in at Clay Creek.  It goes up the corner next to

Lucky Charms

.

content.description: This has good sandstone.  The crux is about halfway up.  It has anchors at the same point as the route to the right.
content.location: This is the third route after reaching the base of the crag.  It is the route on the first arete as you reach the wall.

content.description: Start up 2 bolts then climb into some fun jams and finger locks.  It is fun and has good stances for the one or two placements before the anchor.
content.location:
This is the next route right from

The Queen B.

content.description: Climb fun edges and face holds past two bolts to a 2 bolt anchor.
content.location:
It is located on a small buttress several routes right of "

No Iraq Attack

."

content.description: The first crux is located 10 feet up. It consists of a power move up to the left.  The second crux is a more technical move just below the top. It is a longer move to high pocket next to chains. This is a fun climb for beginners or a good warm up for advanced.  It has good holds and good rock.
content.location: This is the first route as you get to the crag. Look for the bolts behond the tree.  It is easy to find.

content.description: Start with a hard, undercut, deadpoint move.  Clipping the first bolt is easier when it is knee level.  The rest of the route is great fun with spicy bolt spacing up to the anchors.
content.location:
This is two routes right of

Drop In

on the Pipeline Wall.

content.description: This is a fun route left of a fun hand crack.  It starts steep with some techy moves trending left onto the face then a nice rest before a stiff roof with good holds to the anchor.  It has good variety for its length.
content.location:
This is a ways down the trail from where the wall is first encountered.  It is just left of the obvious, steep, hand crack

Special Sauce

with which it also shares an anchor.

content.description: Start at an undercut section of rock, go up a tricky corner, then go left and over a roof (likely the crux), then some cool knobs get you to the anchor.
content.protection: Four bolts to a 2 bolt anchor.
content.location:
After

Special Sauce

, you walk through a more broken area of the cliff.  The climbs are scattered, after a while you come across routes that are characterized by blocky overhangs with better than it looks rock on the lower sections of the route.  This is the third overhanging route encountered just left of a well needed shade tree.

content.description: This is a super fun, steep hand and finger crack that finishes wide.  This can get way dirty after storms.
content.protection: Gear to 3". You can place bigger stuff if you want.  2 bolt anchor.
content.location: This climb is on the Rincon Wall, it is a ways down the trail, and it is the only north-facing wall.  The wall hosts a few climbs all are overhanging and somewhat dirty from little traffic and less exposure to the weather.

content.description: This one offers some good exposure pretty quickly off the ground.  Move up bolts trending right towards the arete, then continue up to the anchor.  The crux is down low a couple bolts up before gaining the arete.  It has a crappy belay area.
content.location: Continue down the trail past The Rincon Wall.  A few climbs are scattered through here.  The route starts off a steep section of trail making it a tough spot to belay.

content.description: The crux is probably getting off the ground, but once climbing the route stays thin and interesting up the corner that leads to the anchor.  The route starts with a 5 foot tall undercut before getting any good holds.
content.protection: Four bolts to a 2 bolt anchor.  A good spotter.
content.location: This climb is all the way down the trail to the last and tallest climbs at clay creek on the Pipeline Wall.  It is the first route encountered on the pipeline wall that is severely undercut.  A little oak stump is by the starting holds.

content.description: The crux for me is at the start. A nasty sidepull/pinch with a small crimper with a BIG left foot up. After that it gets technical with the biggest thing being working out the movements. A really good climb with a lot to offer.
content.location:
It is four routes over from

Lucky Charms

, the first route at the crag.

content.description: Clandestino is a short route with some crimps and sidepulls.
content.location: It is the most left route on the far right wall of the area.

content.description: Cactus Crack ascends a fun, beginner crack.
content.protection: 0.4, two 0.5s, a 0.75, and a 2 bolt anchor.
content.location:
It is just left of

Head Games

.

content.description: Climb the arete with the bolts to the left.  Also, you can climb up to the left of the bolt line for a couple bolts before moving to the arete.  It is a little runout to the anchors, but it is on easier rock.
content.protection: Three bolts to a 2 bolt anchor.
content.location:
This is the next route to the right of

Dr. Evil

.
